text: Narendra "Bull" Kumar, PVSM, KC, AVSM, (also spelled Narinder; (8 December 1933 â€“ 31 December 2020) was an Indian soldier-mountaineer. He was deputy leader of the first Indian successful Everest Expedition in 1965. In 1965, Narendra was awarded Padma Shri, the fourth highest civilian award in India, and Arjuna Award for the first Indian successful Everest Expedition in 1965. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Indian military people Category:Mountain climbers
title: Narendra Kumar (mountaineer)
